p: 1H NMR spectra of the final compounds 5a–m and 9a–c were confirmed with the presence of a D 2O exchangeable singlet signal attributable to the proton of the hydrazide linker at δ (13.31–13.86) ppm. Moreover, 1H NMR spectra for compounds 9a–c confirmed the presence of singlet signal in the aliphatic region for the CH 3 group around δ 2.71 ppm, in addition to the extra aromatic protons for the 6-phenyl ring at a range of δ 7.44–7.57 ppm, whereas, spectra for compounds 5j–m and 14 confirmed the appearance of singlet signal for OCH 3 groups at δ (3.82–3.97) ppm.
